reviews.text: Very plush, good quality and reasonably priced. Breakfast was good quality if a little fancy. No real ales though so we didn't drink or dine there so I couldn't comment on the food. Excellent shower and spotless bathroom. If I go back to the area with the wife this is where I would take her to ensure she wouldn't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Plush

reviews.text: We would like to give Lee, Richard and all the staff a very big thank you for a lovely day on Saturday 21st July, The food was excellent during the day as was the BBQ that evening, the function room looked fantastic and was perfect to hold a wedding breakfast. We stayed the night in a lovely comfy bed and the breakfast was great the following morning. Everything ran smoothly with all the staff friendly and helpfull. Many, many thanks.
reviews.title: Wedding reception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We held our wedding reception here on Saturday 21st July and had a superb time celebrating our big day. Nothing was too much trouble and all the attention to detail were greatly appreciated. Everyone complimented the wedding breakfast and evening BBQ plus the bar is excellent with a great choice of drinks. The function room is perfect for a wedding! Both our families stayed the night and breakfast the following day was lovely. Thank you Lee, Richard and the staff at the Feathers.
reviews.title: Thanks for the perfect wedding reception

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PS. we've also visited the Feathers for a Sunday carvery and would highly recommend it - great value for money.
reviews.title: Excellent stay we will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two nights stay with comfortable bed in big room, welcoming bar/restaurant comfy sofas prior and after dinner for relaxing drink,bet its nice in winter. log fire. Staff very good looked after us well. Food superb, all meals. Very clean and tidy, nice bathroom/shower. Handy for everything. Highly recommended. Thank you
reviews.title: Standard still he same

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately we didn't stop at the Feathers. We had booked to stop 3 nights at the Castle Hotel in Aberaeron. The restaurant at the Castle was closed on the first night so we decided to book a table at the Feathers instead and we are so glad that we did. We ended up eating here for the 3 nights and stopping afterwards for a drink in the bar area as it was much more suited to our tastes than the Castle which could be rowdy on a night. The service is excellent, all staff very efficient and friendly. Good choice of food from several menus (either more expensive "restaurant" type food or from a "bar" menu - all food served in main restaurant). Food was just wonderful, beautifully presented, piping hot and cooked perfectly. Excellent value for money. Nice to sit back in comfy chairs in the bar area afterwards and relax. Judging by how busy they were the restaurant obviously has a well deserved reputation for good food.
reviews.title: Fantastic Restaurant/Bar Area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited here recently whilie staying in Aberaeron , had heard mixed views but decided to give it a go. really glad we did good value for money excellent food and very nice surroundings . would certainly recommend if you are visiting
reviews.title: Great value on italian night

reviews.text: The last time I ate here (15 years ago?) it was so awful that I swore I'd never come back.
reviews.title: Almost there but a little more attention to detail and could be fabulous

reviews.text: However, finding myself in Aberaeron and needing food, and with no tables available in any other restaurant in town, my local companion persuaded me that the refurbished Feathers is much improved and I should give it another try. I was pleasantly surprised, but not wowed by the experience.
reviews.title: service and value

reviews.text: On the plus side, we were able to get a table at short notice, and the food was good value.
reviews.title: Good Food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was lovely, beautifully decorated with good quality furniture, the most comfortable of beds and everything was spotless. I loved that this hotel has some history and character. Staff were attentive and couldnt have been any more friendly. The breakfast was excellent - one of the best ive ever had. All of the food was excellent, good portion sizes and cooked beautifully. Tea tray was generous, loved the coffee sachets and plunger, really nice touch. I would go back if i needed to stay in the area again.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel with character

reviews.text: Overall stay was ok - but you get the idea that this hotel is run on a skeleton staff ! Nowhere seems to be manned, there are bells on reception, and on the bar - and you are supposed to ring when you need attention, but at times its like the Marie Celeste ! - and seems devoid of staff. The TV in the room didn't work and I phoned down to reception, no-one answered so I made the long trek to the ground floor and rang the bell, a gentleman came up to the room and got it going - it packed up 5 mins later. There are wired LAN connections in the rooms, but no wifi - so not much use if you have an iphone or tablet.. When we checked in we were told that breakfast started at 7.30 - so arrived for breakfast at 7.30 as we had to leave early, to be told that on Saturday, breakfast starts at 8.00. Finally our room at the back of the hotel was adjacent ( about two feet away) from the car park - the delivery driver that arrived at 7.00am left his engine running
reviews.title: Needs attention to detail !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: right next to our window, for 15mins while he unloaded. Perhaps it would be a good idea to advise delivery drivers to turn their engines off. This hotel is in a great location, and the staff are very helpful and polite, a little bit of attention to detail would make it a good place to stay.
reviews.title: What a lovely hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three nights at this lovely hotel. Everything was immaculate and spotlessly clean. A very generous tea tray with hot chocolate, choice of milks, quality biscuits etc. Dinner was excellent and breakfasts generous with a large choice of dishes. My husband's request for a mix of items was greeted with a smile and beautifully cooked. I cannot praise this hotel and its staff too highly. Two things would make it absolutely perfect - one minor - more space for personal toiletries in the bathroom, the other greater - a lift would be a great boon for older visitors struggling up a rather steep staircase with luggage. Overall, however, an extremely enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Overall okay, but lots of niggles
Good hotel but lacking something
reviews.text: The room was fine, comfy bed, plenty of space, clean and warm. The staff were friendly but some seemed inexperienced - see below . Very good choice of breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a really nice hotel,my wife and i had a meal there one night during our stay in Aberaeron.It was a lovely meal and excellent service by the staff.It would be a smashing place to stay,but it is little pricey for us,unless they do special offers in the winter months.Also they have their own car park which is a boon in Aberaeron.It is advisable to book if you want to dine at the Feathers.
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.text: We went there with two friends for Sunday carvery and the food was excellent,big portions and the quality was top notch,friendly staff and a great manager,could do with bigger plates !!
reviews.title: An Excellent Sunday Carvery

reviews.text: Try and go in the "new section" a bit more room
reviews.title: Great weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought the rooms were beautiful and the beds were wonderfully comfortable. My evening meal was superb - I had the veggie option. It's worth noting that they don't have wireless internet but you can get broadband by borrowing a cable.
reviews.title: Disappointing
Feathers Royal Hotel Aberaeron
reviews.text: This is not a bad hotel but its just a good 3 star really, the rooms are a bit tired, issues with the TV, the food is average, the service at breakfast is appalling, constantly have to get up to find someone if you need a refill or ketchup etc etc, no bar facilities after 11pm and its a bit expensive, would suggest looking around before settling on this one.
